author: Rebecca Beitsch
description: House Democrats reconvened the House select committee on Jan. 6, 2021, for the fifth anniversary of the attack on the Capitol, reflecting on the significance of the riot and actions from President Trump they say risk the future of American democracy. Staged as a forum, it’s the first time the panel has been assembled since…
title: House Democrats reconvene Jan. 6 committee to counter Trump on anniversary

author: Julia Manchester
description: President Trump endorsed Rep. Henry Cuellar’s (D-Texas) Republican challenger Tano Tijerina on Tuesday, roughly a month after he pardoned Cuellar who was facing charges related to allegedly accepting nearly $600,000 in bribes and laundering the funds. “I don’t know why, but the fact that Henry Cuellar would be running against Donald J. Trump, and the…
title: Trump backs Henry Cuellar’s GOP challenger after controversial pardoning

author: Julia Shapero
description: Elon Musk’s AI chatbot Grok is facing growing backlash from regulators around the world after it produced sexualized images of women and children on the social platform X.  Users began raising concerns about the images last week, as Grok was generating pictures of women and children in sexualized attire in response to user prompts.   The European Commission, the European Union’s…
title: Musk AI chatbot facing backlash over sexualized images of women, children

author: The Hill Staff
description: Democrats are hoping to score an upset victory in a special election for a state House seat in South Carolina on Tuesday. Republican Greg Ford and Democrat Sonja Ogletree Santini, both Air Force veterans, are vying for the seat vacated by state Rep. Chris Murphy (R), who announced his resignation in August. President Trump won…
title: Live results: South Carolina state House special election

author: The Hill Staff
description: Democrats are looking to pad out their narrow majority in Virginia’s state Senate in a special election on Tuesday. Democrat Mike Jones is running against Republican John Thomas in the deep-blue Richmond-area district. Follow Decision Desk HQ’s live results here.
title: Live results: Virginia state Senate special election

author: The Hill Staff
description: Senate Minority Leader Chuck Schumer (D-N.Y.) and House Democratic Leader Hakeem Jeffries (N.Y.) are holding a press conference Tuesday afternoon to mark the fifth anniversary of the Jan. 6, 2021, attack on the Capitol. Their remarks come hours after House Democrats reconvened the select committee that investigated the riots. Democrats are using the anniversary to…
title: Watch live: Schumer, Jeffries speak on fifth anniversary of Jan. 6 Capitol attack

author: Sarakshi Rai
description: President Trump’s threats against Greenland are taking on a newfound resonance in the wake of the U.S. operation to oust Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro. The U.S. president has frequently mused about taking over the semiautonomous Danish territory — which is rich with minerals and well situated in the Arctic to bolster U.S. national security —…
title: Greenland feels tremors after Trump’s shocking move in Venezuela

author: Lindsey Granger, opinion contributor
description: If you’re confused by the White House’s message on drugs right now, you’re not alone — because the logic simply doesn’t add up.
title: Maduro kidnapped, but former Honduran president pardoned? Hypocrisy.

author: Rebecca Beitsch
description: The White House launched a website Tuesday praising President Trump for his handling of the Jan. 6, 2021, attack, simultaneously blaming Democrats for having “masterfully reversed reality” and saying Trump “corrected a historic wrong” in pardoning those charged with crimes related to the storming of the building. The website, which became public on the fifth…
title: White House unveils Jan. 6 webpage saying Democrats ‘staged the real insurrection,’ criticizing Capitol Police

author: Rachel Frazin
description: Energy Secretary Chris Wright plans to meet with oil companies in the wake of the Trump administration’s capture of Venezuelan leader Nicolás Maduro. A spokesperson for the Energy Department confirmed that the meeting will occur, saying in a Tuesday email, “Secretary Wright remains in close contact with U.S. oil companies and plans to meet with…
title: Wright to meet with oil companies as Trump seeks to move on Venezuela reserves

author: Judy Kurtz
description: Actor and podcaster Michael Rapaport says he’s running for New York City mayor in 2029, railing against Mayor Zohran Mamdani (D) just days after the democratic socialist was sworn into office. “I, Michael Rapaport, will be running for mayor of New York City in 2029,” the “Higher Learning” performer said in a video posted on Instagram on…
title: Actor Michael Rapaport says he’s running for NYC mayor in 2029

author: Ryan Mancini
description: Wyoming’s Supreme Court on Tuesday ruled that abortion will remain legal in the state, undoing the country’s first abortion pill ban put into place following the U.S. Supreme Court’s 2022 overturn of Roe v. Wade. State justices, in a 4-1 decision, sided with Wellspring Health Access, the abortion access advocacy group Chelsea’s Fund and four…
title: Wyoming top court strikes down nation’s first abortion pill ban

author: Max Rego
description: Former Transportation Secretary Pete Buttigieg is heading to Wisconsin for a town hall later this month. The event is set for 6 p.m. EST on Jan. 16 in La Crosse, Wisc., roughly three hours northwest of Milwaukee. A description of the town hall says Buttigieg will discuss the cost of housing, child care, health care…
title: Buttigieg set to travel to Wisconsin for town hall amid 2028 speculation

author: Sophie Brams
description: Senate Minority Leader Chuck Schumer (D-N.Y.) ripped the Department of Justice (DOJ) on Monday for blowing past deadlines in its release of information related to the convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein. The Epstein Files Transparency Act, signed into law last November, ordered the DOJ to release all documents regarding Epstein and his longtime associate Ghislaine…
title: Schumer rips DOJ over missed Epstein files deadline

author: Sen. Jon Husted (R-Ohio), opinion contributor
description: The Upward Mobility Act is a proposed bill that would combine multiple federal anti-poverty programs into a single, flexible funding stream to help low-income Americans move up the economic ladder without fear of losing their federal assistance.
title: Helping Americans break free from government dependency

author: Emily Brooks
description: President Trump on Tuesday told House Republicans to be “flexible” in their demands for restrictions against federal funds going to ObamaCare-funded health care plans covering abortion. “Now, you have to be a little flexible on Hyde,” Trump said in reference to the Hyde Amendment, the provision that prevents federal funds from being used on abortion…
title: Trump tells Republicans to be ‘flexible’ on abortion restriction demands in health care

author: Nathaniel Weixel
description: A federal appeals court on Monday upheld a ruling preventing the Trump administration from cutting billions of dollars in support of research payments to universities, medical centers and other recipients  The U.S. Court of Appeals for the 1st Circuit affirmed the ruling of a lower court, which had previously blocked the National Institutes of Health’s plan to cap the “indirect” research payments while…
title: Appeals panel upholds block of NIH research overhead payment cuts

author: Dominick Mastrangelo
description: Will Welch, who has served as GQ’s top editor for the last six years, will leave the company to join Pharrell Williams, the men’s creative director of Louis Vuitton. Welch informed GQ staff of his decision on Tuesday, the New York Times reported, along with other outlets, noting a successor has not been named. His…
title: Top editor Will Welch to leave GQ

author: Ashleigh Fields
description: President Trump said the U.S.will be “running” Venezuela with the support of top officials aiding in a regime transition after the capture of leader Nicolás Maduro.  Maduro and his wife were captured on Saturday in an overnight military operation,leaving Venezuelans uncertain about the state of politics in the Latin American nation. Former Vice President Delcy Rodríguez was…
title: Here are the Trump officials involved in Venezuela transition

author: Sarah Davis
description: The Trump administration has begun a massive immigration operation in Minnesota following a welfare fraud investigation in the state. “GOOD MORNING MINNEAPOLIS!,” the Department of Homeland Security (DHS) posted Tuesday morning on the social platform X.  In a statement shared with The Hill on Tuesday, DHS assistant secretary Tricia McLaughlin said the department “has already made more…
title: Trump administration surges federal agents to Minneapolis in major crackdown

author: Max Rego
description: John Bolton, a former national security adviser to President Trump, said he doesn’t think the president grasps the specifics of the situation in Venezuela in the wake of the U.S. capturing its leader, Nicolás Maduro. Outlining the next steps for the South American country and arguing that Venezuelan opposition leader María Corina Machado and her…
title: Bolton on Trump Venezuela plan: ‘I don’t think he understands anything’

author: Judy Kurtz
description: President Trump says his wife, Melania, isn’t down with his dancing. “She hates when I dance,” Trump said Tuesday while speaking with House Republicans in Washington as part of a GOP retreat. “She’s a very classy person,” the president said while describing how his spouse of more than two decades wanted him to put the kibosh…
title: Trump: Melania ‘hates when I dance’

author: Julia Manchester
description: President Trump warned House Republicans on Tuesday that he will be impeached if the party does not win the midterms, highlighting the stakes of November’s elections.  “You gotta win the midterms. Because if we don’t win the midterms…they’ll find a reason to impeach me,” Trump told the Republican conference at its retreat at the Kennedy…
title: Trump warns Democrats will impeach him if Republicans don’t win midterms

author: Ashleigh Fields
description: An intelligence report from the CIA concluded that the best replacements for Venezuelan regime leader Nicolás Maduro are individuals who previously served within his administration, NewsNation has learned.  President Trump was briefed on the report in recent weeks, which highlighted now-acting president Delcy Rodríguez as a viable successor for Maduro.  The information comes as opposition…
title: CIA concluded Maduro loyalists best positioned to lead Venezuela

author: Ryan Mancini
description: The new director of New York City Mayor Zohran Mamdani’s (D) Office to Protect Tenants previously called home ownership a “weapon of white supremacy.” Cea Weaver, who previously worked as a tenant organizer, said this in a post on the social platform X, then known as Twitter, in August 2019 before her account was deactivated.…
title: Mamdani tenant adviser once called home ownership ‘weapon of white supremacy’

author: Max Rego
description: Rep. Jim Baird (R-Ind.) has been hospitalized after a car accident, his office said Tuesday. “Congressman Baird is in the hospital and is expected to make a full recovery, and he is extraordinarily grateful for everyone’s prayers during this time,” Baird’s office said in a statement. “Congressman Baird looks forward to continuing his work on…
title: House Republican Jim Baird hospitalized after car crash

author: Judy Kurtz
description: Jon Stewart says President Trump helped orchestrate a “reverse ICE” operation to capture Venezuelan leader Nicolás Maduro. “He was actually imported to a jail in Brooklyn,” Stewart quipped of Maduro. Stewart focused his Monday monologue on Maduro while hosting Comedy Central’s “The Daily Show” days after Trump announced that the U.S. had captured Venezuela’s president as part of a “large-scale…
title: Jon Stewart says Trump ‘reverse ICE’d’ Maduro: ‘He was actually imported’

author: Elizabeth Strojan and Ahmed Tigani, opinion contributors
description: The last thing we need during our national housing shortage is to shake investor confidence and make lenders wary of Section 8.
title: Section 8 cuts would send shockwaves through the housing market

author: Jordan Perkins
description: The yearly average for a gallon of gas is expected to be $2.97, down from $3.10 in 2025.
title: National gas price average to fall around $3 per gallon

author: The Hill Staff
description: Jan. 6 defendants, including those pardoned by President Trump last year, are holding a march Tuesday to commemorate the fifth anniversary of the Capitol attack. Former Proud Boys leader Enrique Tarrio, who was convicted on seditious conspiracy and other charges before being pardoned by Trump, is among the organizers of Tuesday’s march. He said the…
title: Watch live: Jan. 6 defendants hold march on fifth anniversary of Capitol riot

author: Bill Press, opinion contributor
description: President Trump's takeover of Venezuela and seizure of Nicolas Maduro is a flagrant violation of international law, and Congress has failed to take any action to stop it.
title: Who needs Congress? Might as well shut it down.

author: Ashleigh Fields
description: The man arrested in connection to vandalism of Vice President JD Vance’s home in Ohio is now facing several federal charges. William D. DeFoor, 26, was reportedly armed with a hammer during the Monday attack and refused to comply with law enforcement, according to the Justice Department.  DeFoor breached the property line and attempted to break…
title: Man facing federal charges in Vance home vandalism

author: Dominick Mastrangelo
description: The Corporation for Public Broadcasting (CPB) will officially dissolve after the body’s board voted to close the organization this week. Created by Congress nearly 60 years ago, the closure follows last year’s rescission from Congress of all of the nonprofit’s federal funding, which came on the heels of sustained attacks by President Trump’s administration and…
title: Corporation For Public Broadcasting votes to dissolve organization

author: Max Rego
description: European leaders backed Greenland’s sovereignty Tuesday amid President Trump’s continued interest in acquiring the island.  French President Emmanuel Macron, German Chancellor Friedrich Merz, Italian Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni, Polish Prime Minister Donald Tusk, Spanish Prime Minister Pedro Sánchez, U.K. Prime Minister Keir Starmer and Danish Prime Minister Mette Frederiksen said in a joint statement that…
title: European leaders: ‘Greenland belongs to its people’

author: John Yochelson, opinion contributor
description: The damage will only be reversed when many more Americans recognize that federal workers are not a commodity but an essential national resource.
title: It’s up to Americans to stop the steamrolling of federal workers

author: Alexander Bolton
description: A group of senior Trump administration officials including Secretary of State Marco Rubio and Secretary of Defense Pete Hegseth will brief all senators Wednesday morning on the situation in Venezuela and President Trump’s plans for managing the power vacuum after the ouster of President Nicolás Maduro. Rubio and Hegseth will join Attorney General Pam Bondi,…
title: Trump officials to brief senators on Venezuela Wednesday

author: Ashleigh Fields
description: Hilton said Tuesday it is dissolving its relationship with a Minnesota hotel that sparked backlash from the Department of Homeland Security (DHS) for denying federal immigration agents from booking accommodations.  “The independent hotel owner had assured us that they had fixed this problem and published a message confirming this. A recent video clearly raises concerns…
title: Hilton removing hotel that sparked DHS accusations from its systems

author: Sarah Fortinsky
description: Former national security adviser John Bolton said Monday that President Trump’s musings about taking over Greenland pose a threat to the strength of the NATO alliance. “As for Greenland, every time he mentions this, Trump endangers the NATO alliance,” Bolton said in an interview on CNN’s “The Source,” when asked about the president’s threats to…
title: Bolton: Trump ‘endangers’ NATO alliance with every Greenland remark

author: The Hill Staff
description: President Trump on Tuesday morning will meet with House Republicans at the Kennedy Center as part of the GOP retreat. His remarks come just days after the U.S. captured Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro and his wife, who have been indicted on narco-terrorism charges. Maduro pleaded not guilty on Monday during his first court appearance in…
title: Watch live: Trump gives remarks at House GOP retreat

author: Max Rego
description: Venezuelan opposition leader María Corina Machado wants to give her 2025 Nobel Peace Prize to President Trump. “I certainly would love to be able to personally tell him that we believe, the Venezuelan people, because this is a prize of the Venezuelan people, want to give it to him and share it with him,” Machado…
title: Machado says she ‘certainly’ wants to give Nobel to Trump

author: The Hill Staff
description: House Democrats, led by Minority Leader Hakeem Jeffries (D-N.Y.) and former members of the panel investigating the Jan. 6, 2021, Capitol attack, will hold a hearing Tuesday morning to mark the fifth anniversary of the riot. The event comes a day after House Judiciary Democrats filed a new report, shared with The Hill, outlining crimes…
title: Watch live: House Democrats mark fifth anniversary of Jan. 6 Capitol attack

author: Gleb Tsipursky, opinion contributor
description: Leaders who treat AI as an operating improvement, not a stunt, are already harvesting repeatable gains.
title: Experts agree: AI is here to stay

author: Julia Manchester
description: President Trump on Monday dismissed comparisons between past U.S. involvement in Iraq and the recent military operation in Venezuela, saying the difference is that the Trump administration plans to keep the seized oil. “The difference between Iraq and this is that [former President George W. Bush] didn’t keep the oil. We’re going to keep the…
title: Trump rejects comparisons between Iraq, Venezuela: ‘We’re going to keep the oil’

author: Sarah Fortinsky
description: Venezuelan opposition leader María Corina Machado, who’s been in hiding for more than 16 months, said Monday that she plans to return home “as soon as possible.” In an interview on Fox News’s “Hannity,” the 2025 Nobel Peace Prize winner told host Sean Hannity that she plans to continue serving her cause of fighting for…
title: Machado plans to return to Venezuela ‘as soon as possible’

author: Sarah Ghermay, opinion contributor
description: I had escaped the 1998 Ethiopian-Eritrean war as a child. I did not anticipate experiencing such an attack on our democracy here in the U.S.
title: I was there on January 6 — it was terrifying and we must never forget

author: Emily Brooks
description: President Trump’s capture of Venezuela’s Nicolás Maduro is giving him an opportunity to redefine “America First” as pro-intervention — but risks fracturing the MAGA coalition. There was some predictable pushback to the strikes from some of the biggest isolationist voices in the Republican Party who have turned into Trump antagonists. Now-former Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greene (R-Ga.) said the strikes represented…
title: Trump’s ‘America First’ base on edge over Venezuela intervention

author: Rhyen Staley, opinion contributor
description: It is not just the teaching of this ideology alone that is of concern, but also the requirement that the youth engage in radical activism to help drive this movement.
title: DEI has no place in our K-12 classrooms

author: Andrew Dorn
description: Households earning more than $150,000 now buy 43% of the new cars sold in the U.S., up from 30% in 2019.
title: New cars kept selling in 2025, just not to everyday buyers

author: Sudiksha Kochi
description: Democrats are using the fifth anniversary of the Jan. 6 Capitol attack to blast President Trump, accusing him of inciting the riot and pledging accountability even as he pardoned hundreds of defendants on his first day in office.  The 2021 riot, which unfolded as lawmakers were certifying former President Biden’s election victory, sent shock waves…
title: Democrats rip Trump on fifth anniversary of Jan. 6 attack

author: Alexander Bolton
description: Republicans are worried that President Trump may embrace a new round of nation-building in Venezuela, something he renounced earlier in his political career.   The prospect of the United States taking over Venezuela is sparking a backlash from MAGA allies, and lawmakers in both parties have many questions about the level of U.S. military involvement…
title: GOP fears Trump’s foray into nation-building in Venezuela

author: Chris Stirewalt
description: Americans seem to be feeling very “late” these days. “Late-stage capitalism” has for a few years been the catchall for the indignities and inconveniences of life for workers and consumers. It is now joined by “late republic,” a lament for the threadbare and tattered Constitution. For many, particularly for the pseudo-intellectuals of social media, the…
title: Is it too ‘late’ to celebrate America 250?

author: Niall Stanage
description: President Trump is flexing U.S. imperial power in an extraordinarily overt way. The impulse extends beyond the seizure of Venezuelan leader Nicolás Maduro. Trump is now beating a threatening drum, with varying degrees of intensity, in relation to Cuba, Colombia and even Greenland. Trump and his allies are ostensibly pursuing this approach as part of…
title: The Memo: Trump sends signal of imperialist muscle in Venezuela

author: Rachel Frazin
description: President Trump wants Venezuela’s oil, but whether and to what extent U.S. energy companies will actually go after it remains an open question.  Over the weekend, following the capture of leader Nicolás Maduro, Trump indicated that the U.S. would run Venezuela’s oil industry — along with the rest of the country. He said that U.S. firms…
title: Trump makes a play for Venezuela’s oil. Will US companies go for it?

author: Caroline Vakil
description: Former conservative lawyer-turned-Trump-critic George Conway officially launched a Democratic bid for New York’s 12th Congressional District on Tuesday, joining an increasingly crowded field to represent the Manhattan-based seat. “We have a corrupt president, a mendacious president, a criminal president whose masked agents are disappearing people from our streets, who’s breaking international law, and he’s running our…
title: Trump critic George Conway launches Democratic bid for Nadler seat in New York

author: Isaac Willour, opinion contributor
description: Netflix’s “kids” programming is … anything but.
title: Conservative investors are fighting child sexualization at Netflix

author: Caroline Vakil
description: The House Ethics Committee announced Monday that it’s extending a review of allegations into Rep. Mike Collins (R-Ga.) and Brandon Phillips, Collins’s chief of staff who transitioned to the congressman’s Senate campaign, releasing a report from the Office of Congressional Conduct (OCC) that raised allegations over the hiring of a past intern in the congressman’s office.…
title: House ethics panel extends review of allegations into Collins, top aide

author: Rachel Frazin
description: {beacon} Energy & Environment Energy & Environment   The Big Story  Trump captures Maduro, eyes Venezuela’s oil industry After the U.S. captured Venezuelan leader Nicolás Maduro, President Trump said he wanted the U.S. to take over the country’s oil production.  © Alex Brandon, Associated Press “As everyone knows, the oil business in Venezuela has been…
title: Trump wants to run Venezuela’s oil industry

author: Max Rego
description: Senate Majority Leader John Thune (R-S.D.) and House Speaker Mike Johnson (R-La.) defended the Trump administration Monday for not consulting Congress ahead of its operation to capture Venezuelan leader Nicolás Maduro. The administration notified the “Gang of Eight” — which includes Thune, Johnson, Senate Minority Leader Chuck Schumer (D-N.Y.), House Minority Leader Hakeem Jeffries (D-N.Y.)…
title: Johnson, Thune say Venezuela operation didn’t require prior authorization
